VLIB Function Reference

Local Binary Patterns

Introduction and Use Cases

Calculate the the Local Binary Patterns of image. The LBP is a powerful feature for texture classification. Please refer to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_binary_patterns

Specification

Function

  • The primary function to perform LBP calculation is VLIB_lbp.

APIS

  • VLIB_lbp


    Parameter     Description
    ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    pInput        Input image pointer                        (UQ 8.0)
    pMapTbl       Pointer to the mapping table               (UQ 8.0)
    pScratch      Scratch buffer, pScratch should be of size
                  imageWidth*imageHeight*6 in bytesand should
                  be 8 byte aligned in memory.               (UQ 8.0)
    pOutHistogram Output LBP histagram                       (UQ32.0)
    imageWidth    Width of the image                         (UQ32.0)
    imageHeight   Height of the image                        (UQ32.0)
    numNeighbouts Number of surrounding pixels.
                  Only numNeighbouts = 8 is supported        (UQ32.0)
    radius        Radius from center to the surrounding
                  pixels in number of pixels.
                  Only radius = 1 is supported               (UQ32.0)

References

  1. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_binary_patterns
